selectSystemEnterValues: First you have to select a system, then enter the values
calculateSystemDetails: Calculation of the systems' performance measures
systemsAvailableQuestion: What kind of systems are available?
systemAvailableQuestionAnswer: We are continuously expanding the range of supported systems. Currently the following ones are available:
cookieConsentText: This website uses cookies to ensure you get the best experience.
aboutContent:
This application was created to make easier learning network analysis. Each calculation was implemented from Dr. Sztrik János - Basic Queueing Theory.

Involved in development Zoltán Szilágyi, Szabolcs Szászi and Csanád Kölcsei. You can find the source code on GitHub.
languageDocumentationDescription: If the language is not supported the fallback will be applied which is en
name: Name
featureIdDocumentationDescription: System feature id presented on the x axis
featuresDocumentationDescription: All of the selected system features. Note: X axis feature id should be equal with to
exportToCSVDescription: Select attributes you want to export
tabTypeChangeWarning: Your modifications will be lost if you change the current scheme.
tabDeleteWarning: You modifications will be lost if you delete the current scheme.
tableDescription: You can calculate selected performance measures based on input values. The result is exportable into different file formats so that you can use it for further work.
chartDescription: You can create figures and compare the performance measures with each other. Also, it's useful for demonstration or learning purposes.
compareTableDescription: You can compare two systems' performance measures with each other.
createTablesFirst: Please generate at least two tables!
kendallDescription: To describe a queueing system we're using Kendall's notation. It uses the following symbols:
kendallDescriptionListItems_A: A - Distribution function of the interarrival times
kendallDescriptionListItems_B: B - Distribution function of the service times
kendallDescriptionListItems_K: K - Capacity of the system, the maximum number of customers in the system including the one being serviced
kendallDescriptionListItems_n: n - Population size, number of sources of customers
whatWeOfferDescription: Currently the application's main features are the calculation and visualization of the systems' performance measures. We're working on new ideas, trying to add new features that can help understand the queueing systems.
creators:
Szilágyi Zoltán
Kölcsei Csanád

cannotCalculateFinalResult: Couldn't calculate final result so nothing to display
errorOccured: You can get more information by clicking on the red button in the table
noCalculationAvailable: Currently there are no calculations available for this system feature
